notes:
1. Definition

The Rate of Return (ROR) or Internal Rate of Return (IRR) is the interest rate at which the present worth of the costs equals the present worth of the benefits. It is the interest rate ($i^*$) that makes the Net Present Worth (NPW) of the project equal to zero.

$$ NPW(i^*) = \sum_{t=0}^{n} \frac{CF_t}{(1+i^*)^t} = 0 $$

2. Minimum Acceptable Rate of Return (MARR)

The MARR is the lowest return that a company is willing to accept on an investment. It represents the opportunity cost of capital.

3. Decision Rule

  • If $IRR \ge MARR$, the project is economically justified.
  • If $IRR < MARR$, the project is not economically justified.

4. Calculation

Calculating IRR usually involves trial and error (interpolation) unless using a financial calculator or spreadsheet. You guess an interest rate, calculate the NPW, and adjust the rate until NPW is zero.

solvedExamples.question: The Internal Rate of Return (IRR) is the interest rate that makes:

options.text: The Net Present Worth (NPW) equal to 0.
The payback period equal to the project life.

solvedExamples.explanation: By definition, the IRR is the discount rate that equates the present value of inflows to the present value of outflows, resulting in an NPW of zero.

solvedExamples.question: A project requires an initial investment of $10,000 and returns $12,000 after one year. What is the Rate of Return?
solvedExamples.explanation: The profit is $12,000 - $10,000 = $2,000. The return on investment is profit/cost = $2,000 / $10,000 = 0.20$ or 20%. Alternatively, solve $0 = -10,000 + 12,000/(1+i)$, which gives $1+i = 1.2$, so $i=0.2$.
